answers.answer: As in the down syndrome, amnio tests? I denied them. Either way I'm keeping him. So I decided not to put him or me through the pain or evasivness.
Why do you want to refuse?
All test I didn't have either of those the gsbt or gtt
I'm getting mine done next week through ultrasound

There really not needed either way im going to keep my baby as far as gtt I know my body and know when something isn't right and I would end up opting out for the IV and use natural remedies or a Hibiclens wash perfer all natural birth without all the drugs and as little intervention as possible
The GTT is important. Often there are no symptoms of gestational diabetes. If untreated your baby can have seizures after birth from sudden drop in blood glucose
The glucose test I did do. It tends to pop up in my families pregnancies and life. So I wanted to be sure. I dont know if its hereditary or genetic. So i did it.
If it was optional i denied it i would never have an abortion even if something was wrong so i figured why do the extras and if they are optional its apparently not a big deal

I refused amino only cos of risk of misscarriage but ihave had every other, theirs nothing wrong with the diabe test its only blood taken ,drink lucasade then have blood again and it's good to have especially if you have diabetes in your family
I refuse the tests too. Either way, this baby is a gift from God. Just do the required blood draws. That's what I did last time too

Over here they do a blood test and ultrasound test before any invasive tests for down syndrome and such. Only after those 3 tests all show a high risk do they do the invasive one.its not that I would not keep the baby if the tests say something was different then average. . I'd just like the time to come to deal with my thoughts before the baby is born if it is so.

question: I didn't have any except the first panel for my son Im considering doing the same with this baby
title: any mom refusing prenatal tests
